li.text:
All Outer Rim modules have been updated, this comes with a lot of little changes that are spread accross them all, instead of doing a note for each one I'm just going to go through it all here real quick.

Research is now no longer faction specific, some other research that didn't feel necessary has also been removed, instead now all armour and weapons are covered by blastersmithing and armoursmithing, heavy weapons and heavy armour research subjects. If anything doesn't fit those like melee weapons, they'll just be unlocked with Hypertech Fabrication.

This also means the faction research cores, and buffs they provided, are no longer in any of the modules.

- Rebalanced the existing factions so now they show up only once you have a higher point value and in smaller numbers. - Changed vambrace body part reliance to shoulders instead of arms to work around an ancient issue with bionics and similar. - Various fixes and typo corrections.
Several full sets of armour and clothing have been added, ranging from ponchos and hermit hoods to bone and composite armour.
A bunch of blasters for unaffiliated gunners are now in this module, including a cycler rifle and scatterblaster.

This update includes the option of two new faction type at world gen, Moisture Farmers, a collection of blaster weilding pawns wearing a variety of the new clothing and armour, and Binary Star Raiders, an always hostile faction alternative to Moisture Farmers. These are set up with the idea that you can either use them to replace the vanilla factions or have them as an addition, or not at all if you just disable them. If you have Galactic Diversity you'll see the xenotypes added in that dispersed throughout the factions too.

- Ion Buildup is now more gradual, and instead of explosive results on mechanoids it'll just kill them, with the same behaviour on the droids in Droid Depot. - Blue blaster projectiles (primarily used by the Galactic Republic weapons) now have a chance of applying a small amount of ion buildup. - Rebalanced Market Value of metals and hypertech components. - Rebalanced costs to craft some weapons. - Hypertech Component recipe is now slightly cheaper and quicker to make. - Taking quests from the holotable now has no cost at all, since you're doing them a damn favour. - Blaster bolts have a new texture.
